file_insights.details: Updated build progress markers, marking tasks 2-1, 3-1, 3-2, 4-1, 4-2, 5-1, 6-1, and 6-2 as completed (✅)
Updated task 6-2 status from 'pending' to 'completed' with verification notes confirming proper package exports

patterns_discovered.description: Systematic verification of exported types and constructors across packages during refactoring
patterns_discovered.evidence: Manual verification of AnalyzerAgent, DocumenterAgent, AIRulesGeneratorAgent and their constructors

patterns_discovered.description: Progress tracking using build-progress.txt with checkbox format for completed/ pending tasks
patterns_discovered.evidence: Consistent use of [✅] and [ ] markers across multiple tasks

gotchas_discovered.description: Export types require proper capitalization (first letter uppercase) to be accessible from other packages
gotchas_discovered.impact: Refactoring must maintain capitalized type names to preserve cross-package access

gotchas_discovered.description: Go conventions require exported types to have exported constructors (e.g., NewTypeName)
gotchas_discovered.impact: Refactoring must maintain constructor naming consistency for proper package accessibility

success_factors: Verified all necessary types properly capitalized (AnalyzerAgent, DocumenterAgent, AIRulesGeneratorAgent)
Confirmed all constructors follow naming convention (NewAnalyzerAgent, NewDocumenterAgent, NewAIRulesGeneratorAgent)
Validated AnalysisResult and FailedAnalysis types are properly exported
Confirmed handlers package uses all exported constructors and types correctly
No code changes required - exports were properly maintained during refactoring
approach_outcome.lesson: Manual verification is effective for ensuring Go package accessibility requirements are met

recommendations.recommendation: Consider adding automated export validation during build process
recommendations.rationale: Would catch capitalization issues early in future refactoring

recommendations.recommendation: Document package accessibility requirements in refactoring guidelines
recommendations.rationale: Ensures consistency across similar refactoring tasks
